User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b12) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b12
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b12) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b12

When visiting webpages originally designed to be popups (ie no toolbars save for a URL bar) by going directly to them via a link (meaning that you're accessing it on the main browser, w/ all toolbars, etc.) and entering fullscreen, fullscreen won't work if you hover over the top of the screen. The only way to alleviate this issue is to manually leave fullscreen mode by right clicking on the URL bar and ending fullscreen mode.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Find a popup webpage (ie the URL I sent).
2. Take the URL to that popup and go to it directly using the main browser.
3. Go into fullscreen mode.
4. Hover over the top part of the page and then anywhere under the URL bar.
5. Compare results to a normal web page.
6. ????
7. Profit!
Actual Results:  
The URL bar will remain there, even if you stop hovering over it. The only way to fix this is to right click the URL bar, exit fullscreen mode, and reenter it.

Expected Results:  
The URL bar should function the same as if it were a regular web page. When your cursor moves away from the URL bar, it should re-collapse.

comments.text:
Hi

Confirming this bug is still on last nightly:
Build identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:9.0a1) Gecko/20110830 Firefox/9.0a1

This is really happening with (all?) pages containing whole *flash objects*. I recommend to include that in the title of this bug.

I have a *fix* that works for me, adding a "mouseover"-event listener besides the "mousemove" one that is currently used to collapse the toolbars.

The fix (patch) in the code would be this: In browser.js, fullscreen section:
Wherever is this line:
	gBrowser.mPanelContainer.addEventListener("mousemove", this._collapseCallback, false);
Should be these:
	gBrowser.mPanelContainer.addEventListener("mousemove", this._collapseCallback, false);
	gBrowser.mPanelContainer.addEventListener("mouseover", this._collapseCallback, false); //<-- add this!!
and same thing with the corresponding 'removeEventListener' lines.

Hope that helps!
